column4: so, does anyone have an idea how after hours of writing 0xff to the disk, it can be full of random gibberish?!
how excactly did you write to the disk?
i don't know dcfldd but i guess it's a pimped version of dd
and /dev/sda is the correct block device?
so you are running a live system from cd?
if you run the live system from USB stick or disk, there must be /dev/sdb or something
or is it a USB cdrom?
/dev/loop0 is just a loop device, it must be connected to something
and how do you read the disk?
i'd suggest using hexdump -Cv since it doesn't leave out the null bytes
but that doesn't explain reading non-ff bytes
maybe this pimped version of dd is buggy?
I don't think it's THAT buggy, as I said I tested it for a few GB before, and just now again, at I see the expected values on the disk
